website_summaries.verdict: The ZTE ZMax 2's mediocre camera quality is a notable drag, but it's a capable phone if you're on a tight budget.
pros: The ZTE ZMax 2 packages a big screen and reliable call quality with a competitively low price tag
cons: The handset is heavy and its camera takes inconsistent photos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Phone
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone. The factory unlocked version has no apps from any service installed. I would say I could install one but the phone does have a data indicator so you know how much data is used and you can set a bar to notify you when your limit has been reached or close to reaching. The phone works great. Does not lag. Picture is great. Camera can get fuzzy with certain lights but so do many other cell phone cameras. Sound is amazing. Sounds so clear coming from a cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: William C

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 years
customer_reviews.text: HA! Only lasted three years (almost to date). I'm sure it's my fault. So many apps. I've dropped it at least 50 times. I live and work with this phone. I monitor remote cameras constantly. About a month ago, the battery began to drain very quickly. Got a new battery, same problem. Repair shop said to "wipe it," but I went ahead and bought another, JUST IN CASE. Best phone I've ever owned. Bought the last one and the new one from this seller. Shipping was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Had phone for about 3 months and the wifi receptor has stopped working and won't let me connect to wifi. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: CMiller

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality look for its price. works great!
customer_reviews.text: looks like any 800 dollar phone minus the price tag. it does the same as any other phone. camera is not the greatest but still functional.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great phone if you wondering should you buy it, buy it. Its a good buy for the price. just get you a SD card so that you can have more space.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! Cricket tried to tell me the sim card wouldn't fit. Took it home preparing to send it back but my husband put the sim card in and it works perfectly for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ZTE XMax 2
customer_reviews.text: Update: this phone has lost its ability to connect to the WiFi. It is now useless as far as connecting to the internet via WiFi. ZTE made an exception and paid shipping to send to their repair facility, kept the phone 3 weeks and supposedly 'repaired' it and returned it to me in the same unworking wifi condition. Now they want me to spend more time 'chatting' with them about the phone's problems. They should just replace it. Otherwise it was a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: PSU grad

customer_reviews.title: Like the first zmax it still has problems with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Like the first zmax it still has problems with the proximity sensor but other then that it is a great phone
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ZTE SHOULD INVEST IN PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
customer_reviews.text: The phone is not all that I expected it to be. Honestly, my gut was telling me to keep my previous device and cancel the order. It is not a terrible phone, hints the three stars, but it is a downgrade, in terms of features. And, the app aggregation feature has a glitch which makes it hard to group like apps together.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, durable phone
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, durable phone. My mom has had the first version of it for almost 2 years with no problems at all. I've purchased 2 more for other family members and all of them are working great. Easy to use with all Android's features untouched! Nice sound as well. Does the job of a big screen for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Chelseamaria

customer_reviews.title: Best value out there
customer_reviews.text: Had a Samsung Note 4 before this phone and I haven't missed it once.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great phone husband loves it. He rarely gets new things for himself.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using this phone now and it's awesome -sauce
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first issue with this phone arose when I was ...
customer_reviews.text: My first issue with this phone arose when I was connected to wifi and using my BT headset. People would tell me my voice would go "robotic" sounding. Theirs also would occasionally sound that way to me. If I turned off wifi, no issues. Later, I found that my phone would not connect to wifi unless it was right next to my router. Even if I was only 10 ft. away from the router, nothing. My latest issue is that unless I have an active call, I do not receive incoming calls. It rings once and goes directly to VM. I had a Windows Nokia Lumia 640 and never had these issues BT, wifi or otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: LAB

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 yrs now, & it's great. The only problem​ I've encountered is, for some reason after I did the most recent device update, on occasion it will tell me that my PIN is incorrect. I have to restart the phone in order for it to accept my PIN & unlock. Other than that, it's worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse_B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value: this phone was one of my best purchases ever, certainly the best smartphone I ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy it from Amazon, I got it elsewhere on Cyber Monday. If you need the latest and greatest flagship phone, this isn't it. But if you are looking for a lot of bang for your buck, you found it here. I have owned it since Thanksgiving of 2016 and it has everything I need: speed, unbelievable battery life, enough internal storage.
customer_reviews.author: langerking

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Has 80% of the specs of $600 ...
customer_reviews.text: Got mine for $90. Great phone. Has 80% of the specs of $600 flagship phones. It's not quite as well built as my GF's Galaxy S7 Edge, but it's still really solid. Works flawlessly with my standard AT&T SIM card. If I had one complaint, it's that the device is too big. The screen is huge.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone and Price
customer_reviews.text: First time buyer of unlocked phone. Very pleased with the ZTE product. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Arzel Byers Ivy

product_meta.title: ZTE Z Max 2 16GB 5.5" HD Display Unlocked GSM Quad-Core Android Smartphone w/ 8MP Camera - Black
product_meta.description: The latest smartphone features at the right price. Giant, Vivid images take in large, vibrant images on the responsive 5.5” HD touchscreen. Love games and movies? Max 2 graphics will jump out at you. Rich soundscapes Dolby audio speakers enrich your experience of music, movies, and games. Slide on those earbuds and fly away into other Sonic worlds. The storage you need now you really can take it with you utilizing the 16GB internal storage2, as well as 32GB of expandable memory. (Microsd card sold separately.) packed with photo and video features just point and shoot to take gorgeous photos with the 8MP rear-facing camera or snap perfect selfies with the 2MP front-facing camera. Set a timer to join your friends in a group portrait. See full-screen previews before you shoot to Get the shot you want. Rely on Built-in flash. Review and geo-tag your photos and videos onscreen. The latest Android interface delightfully easy to use, Max 2 features Android 5.1, the most advanced Android interface, enabling you to connect to the Internet quickly via Built-in Google apps like chrometm, Google play stores, and much more.
feature_bullets: 4G LTE unlocked Phone - supports AT&T, T-Mobile, MetroPCS, Cricket & other gsm-based Networks
